topics.body:
It probably fits better in the video game thread, but I heard a actually interesting theory on why fps shooters are in decline.

Basically the idea behind it was that games like call of duty and halo overinflated the fps market and now that that those sorts of games no longer are the super popular games the genre is going through a sort of bubble pop.  You know how like fifteen years ago prepubescent teenagers weren't *just* interested in generic fps shooter games but interested in all sorts of games?  Basically that.

We *might* see a new golden age of gaming cause the games that are super popular right now, games like LoL or minecraft or such, companies can not even close to compete against even if they try to do the scummy thing of making cheap ripoffs so that might force companies to actually try to innovate with their games.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
